Trekking Gears And Equipment Needed To Trek In Kullu Manali

11 Feb 2019 - The Trippy Frog


Before going for trekking in the Himalayas you need to make sure that you have the proper gears and equipment packed in your backpack to help you out in the times of need You need to make sure that your rucksack is light. You need to think wisely before buying any gear. Finding the best and budget-friendly gear can be a pain in the Ass. So we have listed some of our recommended gears to help you out.


Back Pack :

A backpack/rucksack is one of the most important gear when it comes to trekking in the Himalayas. It is the most essential gear that you will be carrying with you all the time when you go for a trek in the Himalayas. The comfort, size, capacity, and durability are the factors you need to keep in mind before buying a rucksack.

What Capacity Should I Buy ?

The size of capacity or rucksack depends on how long is your trek and how many days you are to spend in the mountains. The longer the trek the bigger the rucksack gets. For 2 to 3 days weekend trek backpack of 40 - 50 ltr is sufficient whereas for the long trek of 4 - 6 days you will be needing a backpack of 50 - 70 ltr . And if you are going for high altitude trek more than 8 days then 70 ltr backpack or above.

Why Waterproof Backpack ?

The weather in the mountains is unpredictable it can shower anytime so you need to prepared for that situation. the Backpack you be carrying with you should be waterproof or at least has a rain cover.

Some Of Our Recommended Backpacks ?

  • Quechua
  • Wildcraft
  • The North Face
  • Tripole


FootWear :

Hiking/Trekking shoes are one of the most important quipments that can make or break your trek in the Himalayas .Trekking shoe is very different form normal sports or running shoes . The trekking shoe sports your ankle and feet in any terrain without twisting or injuring your foot . before buying the trekking shoe you need in keep in mind some key factors like
a) the kind of terrain of trek .
b) Number of days you would be using the shoes - weekend or Expedition.
c) Season of Trek - Monsoon trek or Snow trek .
d) the weight you will be carrying

Key Feature of good trekking shoes

  • Waterproof for different kinds of weather .

  • Built material which helps protect your feet from getting hurt/ twisted .

  • Great ankle support on any kind of terrain .

  • Good grip and traction on all kinds of terrains without slippage .

  • Durability and usage for a long period of time.

  • Cushioning, comfort and breathability for long hour trekking.

Some Of Our Recommended Shoes ?

  • Quechua
  • Solomon
  • Wildcraft
  • Columbia
  • Woodland


Sleeping Bags ?

RECENT POSTS


Pemba Gelje Sherpa Sets New Speed Record on Manaslu, Tyler Andrews Forced to Turn Back

Pemba Gelje Sherpa conquered the peak of Manaslu at 7 am Nepal time, completing the ascent 12 hours after leaving Base Camp. Surpassing the previous record set by Francois Cazzanelli, Gelje Sherpa shaved off an hour from the fastest known time. Meanwhile, American climber Tyler Andrews, who commenced his journey an hour earlier than Gelje Sherpa, had to turn back before reaching the summit.

Read


After being missing for 3 days, an Indian climber was rescued from a crevasse.

According to the organizer of the climbing expedition, an Indian climber who disappeared on April 17 has been found and rescued from a crevasse where he had fallen 5,600 meters above sea level in Annapurna. The climber was located 300 meters beneath the surface.

Read


Tragic News Famous Climber Noel Hanna Passes Away on Annapurna

A renowned irish climber Noel Hanna passed away on Mt Annapurna. He was a very experienced climber who had summited Mt Everest ten times before. Noel Hanna had just returned from the summit point when he passed away at Camp IV. It is not clear what caused his death.

Read


There is a missing climber on Annapurna

According to The Himalayan Times Anurag Maloo from India was descending from Camp 3 when an accident took place. He had given up his goal to reach the summit at Camp 4 and was heading back to Base Camp. His outfitter, Seven Summit Trek's, reported the incident and an aerial search is currently being conducted.

Read


Mourning Pasang Lama Seru, the Khumbu Trail Builder

Pasang Lama Sherpa, also known as Lama Seru, was recently mourned by Sherpas on social media for his passing. Lama Seru, a well-known figure on the trails of the Khumbu Valley, had never reached the summit of Mount Everest, yet he remained a crucial and often unrecognized hero of the area. For many years, he generously volunteered his time to repair, maintain, and expand the local trails. At the age of 79, Lama Seru passed away, leaving behind a legacy of selfless service to the community.
